dataSetInformation.common:synonyms: Fastening pin; Pop rivet; Blind rivet; Solid rivet; Semi-tubular rivet
Fastening pin; Pop rivet; Blind rivet; Solid rivet; Semi-tubular rivet
dataSetInformation.common:generalComment: A rivet is a mechanical fastener that consists of a smooth cylindrical shaft with a head on one end. Upon installation, the tail is deformed to hold the rivet in place, resulting in a permanent fixing. Rivets are commonly used in aircraft, bridges, structures, and various manufacturing industries. Their technical aspects include material composition, diameter, length, head type, and mechanical properties. They may comply with specific industry standards and be subject to quality control measures. Usage information often indicates which materials or structures they are intended to join. There is no specific ‘production route’ as rivets can be made from various metals or non-metallic materials depending on their application, and there is no single ‘educt name’ or production mix associated with rivets. They are available in a wide variety of sizes and materials for different uses, either to consumer or at plant.

铆钉是一种机械紧固件，它包括一个平滑的圆柱形轴和一个端部的头。安装时，尾部变形以保持铆钉到位，从而形成永久性固定。铆钉通常用于飞机、桥梁、结构和各种制造行业。其技术方面包括材料成分、直径、长度、头部类型和机械属性。它们可能符合特定行业标准，并接受质量控制措施。使用信息通常指出它们打算连接哪些材料或结构。由于铆钉可以根据其应用从不同的金属或非金属材料制成，因此没有特定的‘生产路线’，也没有与铆钉相关联的单一‘原料名称’或生产混合物。它们以多种尺寸和材料可供不同用途使用，无论是向消费者还是在工厂。
